course.subject: COMP
course.name: Introduction to Natural Language Processing
course.description: Human language technology for text and spoken language. Machine learning, syntactic parsing, semantic interpretation, and context-based approaches to machine translation, text mining, and web search.
course.prerequisites: ELEC 2600 OR IELM 2510 OR MATH 2411 OR MATH 2421 OR MATH 2431

Human language technology for processing text and spoken language. Fundamental machine learning, syntactic parsing, semantic interpretation, and context models, algorithms, and techniques. Applications include machine translation, web technologies, text mining, knowledge management, cognitive modeling, intelligent dialog systems, and computational linguistics.

reviews.comment_workload:
The most heaviest workload course in HKUST. Even heavier than all LANG courses or SOSC and HUMA common core. There a three assignments.
The first assignment will waste you about 5 days to complete.
The second assignment will waste you about a week to complete it.
After the deadline of second assignment, the third assignment will release. The workload is three times of the second assignment, which mean you have to use about 3 weeks to complete a single assignment individually.
Even worse, there are many system maintenance. Your assignment progress will force to stop during maintenance. Eventually, the time for you to complete the assignment will reduce.
Another serious issue is an assignment will divide to three parts. Each part will release each week, which mean you cannot finish the next part before it release. So, you won't be able to plan finishing all parts during its release.
As assignment 3 is released at the last of the semester. you will be very busy.

reviews.author: 2042XXXX
reviews.title: if (professor == dekai) { students->course.drop();}
reviews.comment_content:
The content of this course is supposed to be rich, giving students ideas what NLP is.

There are 3 assignments, midterm and final in the course.

The assignment in this course is full of idealism that Dekai wishes the TA to design yet the TA has no time to do it at all. I personally felt bad for the TA as
1. The TA don't even have any materials sent by Dekai
2. The TA is asked by Dekai to asked question that he never mention and define in class (Search Bias), so basically the TA doesn't know what does it mean either.

All in all, there are 3 assignments in this course for this semester, in which assignment 1 was a easy and basic one, and I already get lost in assignment 2 and 3 as I have no way of catching up and understanding his ideas.

As a sidenote, the assignment 3 was broken up into Part A, B and C and suppose we would hand in part by part. This caused a lot of confusion to the class at first and the deadline was unclear at the first.

The Midterm consists of discussion in class about ethnics and some basic hazards he thinks AI could do to humanity (not strictly related to NLP but that's his style), some POS tagging which he spend only one lecture and giving no exercise to us and suppose we will achieve 100% marks from that after weeks of introduction. Seriously is this set up to fail us? I don't know, but most of us can't even understand the POS tag basics during that lecture.

Let's be clear that I did not study for the final because I have already given up the course by that point. It consists of a lot of pseudo programming using C++ syntax and also some question yet again discussed in class.

All exams are open handwritten notes (although the definition of "handwritten notes" is not clearly defined by the professor and TA)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although I gave the grade E here, but let's admire him for one of the very few professor that in UST who teaches with passion and energy. I do think he really does a great job of enhancing the atmosphere of the classroom.

These traits, however, is neglected by how unclear, messy, unstructured and unreleased lecture notes to further help understanding to the deep and wide knowledge I wish the course provides to me.

I wish he knew that not all and actually most of his students are not genius and would like step by step approach to have a better introduction to this matter. While I'm okay with his introduction of the backgrounds, his content and difficulty skyrocketed as he is skipping many ideas without even explain it slowly, and not having any contents on what he's trying to say in class just made everything worse and worse.
reviews.comment_grading:
Dekai never gave any clear definition of the grading scheme of the course, but I got C-. He does say you will get guarantee grading on achieving certain point, but I saw some reviews already include this so I am not bothering to repeat here.

Let just say it is relatively good as I didn't do 75% of assignment 3, and most things I wrote in the final, I actually have no ideas what I am doing. I was expecting to get an D or F, but C- was really unexpected.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy. with assignments released and due in a week, many students found it hard to complete with in time. He, however is willing to extend the deadline often as quite clearly the class has stated that we all have no idea what you homework is all about.

And lastly to those who read all of my grumble till to this very end, thank you and please, if you want some introduction to NLP, don't take this course. It is not worth your time to waste here.

reviews.title: DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!

Do not take this course if you want to learn natural language processing. Go to MIT / Standford / Coursera / Udemy instead.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!

Well, this semester's teaching is done through ZOOM so you won't have the problem of missing a lecture or write notes since you can just re-watch the lecture recordings.
So the problem of not giving out lecture notes mentioned in previous reviews would not be as big of a problem than normal face to face lectures.
But it would be better if Dekai can released the lecture notes since without the lecture notes, I needed to type the lecture notes myself in a word document during the lecture, which is annoying.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!

My grades for pop quiz:

My grades for assignment:
Assignment 1: 100/100 (Some students obtained 5 more points for bonus)

My grades for class participation:
I don't know my grades for class participation, because Dekai never released the grades for this part.
I would just guess that I get a mean mark for this part, since I would consider my participation in the class would be normal.
But still, I don't know how this part is graded because a clear marking scheme for class participation is not there for us to see.
So if he wants, he can just gives you bad grade just because you look ugly, or gives you good grade, if you kept on liking his boots.


My grades for forum participation:
I don't know my grades for forum participation, because Dekai never released the grades for this part.
But I would just guess that I got a pretty good grade for forum participation, since I would say that I was quite active in the forum, answering questions and asking questions.

My grade: B+

So I figured that for grading 13 students in a curve, a lenient A range, full marks assignment, okay class participation and good forum participation, then I would expect an A-. But he gives B+ for me, lower then I expected.

With no grading detail and mark release for class and forum participation, weighting percentage (with the disappearing pop quiz). The grading was not transparent at all. So expect your final grade to be marked subjectively.
reviews.comment_workload:
DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!

Mid-term/Final:
No mid term and final for this semester, so you don't need to memorize how Dekai Wu is spelt. (To be honest, I think every CS student in HKUST knows his name since he was quite infamous for his teaching, just look at the other reviews)

Assignments:
Assignments are due in one week ~ 1.5 weeks, and it is quite hard to finish them in time especially if you are year 4 with FYP or took a lot of courses in that semester.

Assignment 1: Dijkstra Anagram
Assignment requirement is to write a program to do Dijkstra algorithm for generating anagram.
This first assignment is okay, not too difficult.
But for getting the 5 points bonus it is quite hard, since your program need to run fast enough within 20s for 14 character length word, which required you to use some sort of pruning to achieve that efficiency.

Assignment 2: HMM
Assignment requires to write a program for Hidden Markov Model backward forward algorithm.
This assignment is hard, since the concept and equations of backward and forward algorithm and HMM is quite difficult and complicated. So you need to spend a lot of time to understand it.
And with the complicated equations, debugging takes a long time.

Assignment 3: Feedforward POS Tagger
Assignment requirement is to loop through the scientific method for feed forward part of speech tagger.
This assignment is easy in terms of coding, since for every hypothesis, just a few lines of code is needed to be changed.
The annoying part is that you would need to write observations of the training set, description of hypothesis, and do error analysis for each hypothesis.
And because I didn't know whether the answers are correct or not, I tried to write as long as possible for the description and explanation, which I used a lot of time to do. I don't know whether it is necessary to write so long, but in the end I got 100/100

Assignment 4: RNN
Assignment requirement: create bidirectional RNN, LSTM, and bidirectional LSTM model for tagging part of speech for the training set with the starting code of RNN.
I would say this is the most useless and annoying assignment because the machine learning framework used in this assignment is LEGO, which is developed by Dekai and his TAs.
Why the hell would you ask the students to use C++ and your own LEGO machine learning framework, but not python with state-of-the-art machine learning framework such as pyTorch or Tensorflow?
Not to mention that because the framework is developed by Dekai and his TAs, there are no documentation that you can refer to understand how LEGO actually works.
So you would spend a lot of time trying to understand the starting code with the comments, do trial and error to understand how different function works and the output of different variables.
Basically, this assignment teaches you to use LEGO machine learning framework, which you would never ever use again in your whole life. (Unless you decide to do postgrad and become his TA)

reviews.author: Luoshu
reviews.title: I have no idea what the hell dekai is talking about.
reviews.comment_content:
The course title about the course is "natural language processing". However, I have no idea what the professor is talking about.

The course material related to the NLP is taught after the midterm exam. Before the midterm, it is all about some historical staff. (In fact, I am not a fan in history and humanity. I cannot remember what exactly it is taught.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Normally, in one lecture, the professor will talk something about himself or the AI ethics (such as some buzz word about him being elected to some council). Afterwards, he may deliver some jibber jabber about the language history or some other boring staff.

To be honest, at the first two weeks of the semester, I think it was my problem that I cannot understand the content and the purpose of his teaching. However, after several weeks, when I realized that the teaching is not understandable at all.

Ultimately, if you are really a huge fan of painful experience (or "抖M" in Chinese), I strongly recommend you to take this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
To my great surprise, the grading is astonishingly good. For your information, the weight of assignments are very high, so please make sure you complete all assignments in a serious attitude.

After checking my final exam, I have scored below the mean score. However, I am still able to obtain an A- grade. Anyway, this is a course that you don't have any idea about the grading detail.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 5 assignments in total. Due to the fact that I need to count on those assignments, I need to finish them in a deep and complete way. In fact, I have no idea how these will affect me. Therefore, all I can do is to write my report as long as possible.

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.title: Weird course
reviews.comment_content:
Content covers the following topics:
1. Bigram models
2. Anagramming
3. HMM
4. IBM Models for Machine Translation
5. ITG Models for Machine Translation
6. CFG/PCFG/CYK Algorithm for parsing

The content is quite old. Agreed that some of these are important topics in this field but I expected an introduction to Neural MT or something.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I didn't like the teaching whatsoever. People say he's very passionate about the field etc etc. Agreed, but while teaching a course there should be a solid structure of content and way to assess students. 12 weeks of classes feel like a blur when you heard a lot of things but don't quite understand them too well.

There are no lecture notes as such. In class, a pdf of his book (should have been printed 3 years ago)  is used an then a printout is given before the exams. This makes it very difficult to take good notes and clear doubts during the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
Dekai's grading scheme is very flexible and changes almost every year he teaches. He doesn't tell us the final scheme he used but a rough idea is
5% participation
50% assignments
20% midterm
25% final

Depending on how many assignments he gives, he adjusts the weight of the exams. He originally planned to teach scheme but due to lack of time, gave only 1 programming assignment and 1 written assignment. Also, he doesn't release the score of the final. (Yes, quite a few unknowns in the course)

I would say the final grade isn't that bad. His midterm is very easy and scoring. Final is definitely a bit harder. A range should not be very difficult.
